summary: Human Resource Management X Business Administration

Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Science - BSc (degree not obtained)

certifications.name: Intensivo de Lengua y Cultura Españolas

projects.title: Boundary Calendar
projects.description: During my masters, me and my teammates worked on an application that helps young adults to set appropriate work/life boundaries to create a healthier lifestyle. Boundary Calendar would do this by providing its users with a personalized schedule, which reduces the state of feeling overwhelmed. The application increases productivity and it contributes to the state of happiness of young adults who decide to use this platform. The proposed application is rewarded by my professor Jeffrey Sweeney, during the elective Human-Centered Process Development in the master programme of Business Information Management, with an 8.8

projects.title: Bakelicious
projects.description: For the RSM Entrepreneurship Challenge, me and the team were challenged to build a start-up company from the ground up by attending quality lectures and putting our knowledge to practice. My responsibility was regarding the marketing of the products, by selling it to my group of clients. The project was rewarded by my tutor Nour Bahadori Motlagh with a 7.5

contributors.headline: Student aan de/het Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

projects.title: Servant leadership and in-role employee performance through a mediation and a moderation model. A Dutch context.
projects.description: My thesis observed the business approach of servant leadership, by focusing on the effect of servant leadership behavior in managers from the perspective of the employee on the in-role employee performance from the perspective of the manager. By testing multiple hypotheses, the results would serve the greater purpose of how to introduce the new generation in the workforce. This could help them in having a positive and meaningful impact on their environment.

projects.title: GOOGLE
projects.description: For the course Corporate Finance, given by my professor Florian Madertoner at the Rotterdam School of Management, my report focused on the in-depth analysis and the revenue model of GOOGLE. This report is rewarded by Florian Madertoner with a 6.5

contributors.headline: Lecturer Corporate Finance at Rotterdam School of Management Erasmus University

projects.title: Talent Acquisition individual assignment
projects.description: For this assignment, the professor asked us all to evaluate a number of candidates for a company. Furthermore, we were asked to evaluate recruitment processes, which are a small part of TA, from our own experiences. My assignment was rewarded with a 7.8 by Sahar Hofmeijer, the teaching assistant

projects.title: The perfect candidate for Bever
projects.description: During the assignment, me and my four team members were looking for the perfect CEO at Bever. In this process, the needs of the company and the needed requirements that had to be found in the perfect candidate for the position were evaluated. After the interviews, where we invited three candidates, the candidate that was most suitable for the job was selected and we proposed our recommendation for the candidate that was a wonderful fit for the company. The thought process in deciding the perfect candidate was presented by two of my team members and this combination got rewarded with an 8.2 by the teaching assistant, Sahar Hofmeijer

contributors.headline: HR Specialist | Psychology & Tech | Mentorship Lead @Re:Coded

projects.title: Individual assignment Human Resource Management
projects.description: For my final assignment during my bachelor Business Administration for the course Human Resource Management, the assignment was evaluated by the professor Colin Lee. This assignment focused on several presented problems in different departments of HR; including brand management, learning and development and employee rewards. Colin Lee rewarded my propositions with an 8.0

projects.title: Supply chain management final project
projects.description: For the course supply chain management in my final year of my studies in Business Administration, we were challenged to evaluate the perfect location for the warehouses of the mentioned company. We were awarded a 7.8 for this assignment. In the second assignment, the university asked us to further develop the decision that was made in the first assignment and rewarded us with a 7.5 for our proposition

contributors.headline: Supply Chain Planner bij Koppert Biological Systems

projects.title: Doing bad things for good reasons; predictors of unethical pro-organizational behavior
projects.description: This collaborative thesis focused on pro-organizational unethical behavior, of which one of the research questions focused on the willingness to participate in such behavior resulting from a high sense of organizational identification. Simultaneously, me and my two teammates looked into the origin of such behavior, with a focus on the loyalty of the employee towards the organization, because it can bring positive results to the organization. Nevertheless, the question arises about whether managers should accept this behavior and whether they should stimulate it, given the operations of the organization and the environment in which the organization operates. We were rewarded with a 7.5 by the co-reader.

projects.title: Brand awareness for V&D as an online webshop
projects.description: During my minor strategy consulting in the third year of my studies, my focus as a practicing strategic consultant was on presenting a strategic opportunity for the online webshop of www.VD.nl to enhance their brand awareness amongst (potential) customers. My professor Jacomijn Klitsie rewarded the project with an 8.5

contributors.headline: Associate Academic Director BSc Programmes at Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

projects.title: Interimproject with diverse themes
projects.description: For my studies in my third year of Business Administration, me and four other students participated in the interimproject with the subject Management Concepts or Hypes. Our project focused on the new way of working and its effect on the employees. It discussed the difference between the two terms mentioned to understand the dilemma between the two stakeholders who are effected most by it; employees and managers. Our final report is rewarded with a 7.8. With a group of 124 students in total, each team presented the final findings during a small conference that was organized by our professor Marja Flory. Our final participation is evaluated by Marja Flory and our group that consisted of fourteen students in total is awarded with a bonus because of the coordination of the individual teams within our theme group. My individual participation was awarded by our professor Marja Flory with an 8.1

contributors.headline: Student aan de/het Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
Forecast & Replenishment Planner bij MediaMarkt Nederland
Supply Chain Planner bij Koppert Biological Systems

projects.title: Sustainable Development Goals and the Indian Oil Company
projects.description: For this project, we were presenting a strategy to incorporate the Sustainable Development Goal number 12, Responsible Consumption and Production, in the day-to-day activities of the Indian Oil company. We then related this to Sustainable Development Goal number 3, Good Health and Well-being, because these are interrelated with each other. We then argued the relevance and the importance of these SDG’s for the organization. Together with the SDG debate and the strategy poster my tutor rewarded me with a 7.7 for the course

contributors.headline: Student aan de/het Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

projects.title: NANuomo
projects.description: For the Marketing Management Event during my studies in the second year of Business Administration, me and my teammates provided www.nanuomo.com with a marketing plan to enhance the brand awareness of the store amongst (potential) clients. The store is located at Hofplein 32 in Rotterdam, The Netherlands. As a team, we won the price for best idea which is awarded by the employees of NANuomo

contributors.headline: Student aan de/het Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

projects.title: Project KLM
projects.description: This assignment focused on the Koninklijke Luchtvaartmaatschappij (KLM) with the goal of identifying the type of company that is based on several business processes; Human Resource Management, Finance & Accounting, Operations, Marketing and Informationsystems. Furthermore, me and my teammate Kaching Chan focused on the external environment according to the PEST-model, strategy and other important aspects.

projects.title: RSM, mission and business relationships
projects.description: For a project during my studies in the second year of Business Administration, me and my teammates took a critical look at the problem that the university is facing regarding their negative media attention. One of the missions of the Rotterdam School of Management is to teach students about the economic system while most businesses main goal of theirs is to generate profit. As a team, our positive solution in which one of the ideas is to close the gap between these two stakeholders, is rewarded by my professor sir van Oosterhout with a 9.5

contributors.headline: Junior Business Consultant in International Organisations at NTT DATA

projects.title: Strategic businessplan BRI Groep
projects.description: For a project during my studies in the first year, me and my three teammates participated in the course Introduction to Business. We worked on a strategic business plan for www.BRIgroep.nl and analyzed both internal and external factors that affect the company growth. This businessplan eventually provided the company with strategic objectives for company growth in three departments; operations, human resources and marketing. We were perfectly supported by the owner of the company, Dennis Roomer. The owner and two of his employees, Rob Lentz and Danielle Spaans, provided us with the right information. Because of this gentle support, we were able to successfully present our proposition to our coach Steffie Broere, who awarded our proposition with a 7.5

contributors.headline: Data & Technology Trainee at De Nederlandsche Bank
Consultant Intelligent Process & Performance bij Capgemini Invent
Domain Lead Customer Success at Nedap Retail

projects.title: De impact van de tweede feministische golf - [The impact of the second wave of feminism in the Netherlands]
projects.description: For this project in my final year in middle school, me and my teammate investigated the objectives of the second wave of feminism, which we concluded were successfully completed in the Netherlands. After this evaluation, me and my co-author proposed future research about the third and fourth wave of feminism in the Netherlands. This final project is related to the field of history and it is rewarded with an 8.0 by my teacher Mrs. van Kempen

contributors.headline: SOC Analyst at Hunt & Hackett | Associate of (ISC)² (CISSP)

profile_positions.description: www.youngcapital.nl found me an opportunity at www.bol.com as a customer services representative, where www.teleperformance.nl provided me and my colleagues with courses to succesfully perform at the job.
profile_positions.title: CRM-specialist

profile_positions.description: While working for www.turbotheorie.nl, my knowledge in problem solving skills increased through careful training by one of my managers. With one-on-one meetings he helped me both in my personal and professional development, which stimulated my analytical thoughtprocess and customer support skills. Through this, my interest in process development was sparked, which led me to my decision to participate in the elective Human-Centered Process Development during my masters. One of my other managers thought me about business process design, by becoming his business assistent and giving me the responsibility over the company when he was picking up other responsibilities.
profile_positions.title: Customer services specialist

profile_positions.description: www.youngcapital.nl outsourced me to three of the physical stores of www.hm.com in the Netherlands. During this period of labour, my activities included responsibilities over the pay desk and the sales representative for customers.
profile_positions.title: Sales representative

profile_positions.description: Through People Marketing Nederland, we recruited supporters of non-profit organizations for (long-term) donations. This was done by us through the marketing of the appointed non-profit organization.
profile_positions.title: Marketing

profile_positions.description: During my time at V&D me and my colleagues were sales representatives for three departments on the ground floor; including the rituals shop-in-shop and the Jane Norman shop-in-shop. In holidays we helped each other with the responsibilities for each employee seperately. My responsibility for the pay desk existed in the last two departments mentioned.
profile_positions.title: Sales representative

profile_positions.description: Maatschappelijke stage/An internship related to community services.
profile_positions.title: Playgroup assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: Before the pandemic, my activities as a volunteer included supporting staff in hospitality, whereas during the pandemic my contribution to the elderly centre existed in taking care of the elderly of the town, being a good companion and supporting staff in hospitality as well
